titleStmt.title: The school of Venus. VVhen lusty lads and lasses meet, and merrily do play; the pleasures are so strong and sweet, both sexes love obey. Tune of, Hail to the mirtle shade.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Josiah Blare, at the Looking-Glass on London-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "How long shall I sigh and mourn ..."
Date and place of publication from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
